title: Something Hotter than your Neighbor's Life
description:
The Commandments begin with Israel seeking liberation, but she imagines her liberation must be from an external oppressor. God accomplishes this for her,  but the real work is revealed to be the liberation from what is inside of her. 

The commandment against coveting addresses this. We are grabbed not just by our desires but our desires of what another possesses. This puts at war against each other only stopped by the threat of violence. Jesus doesn't use this tool, but instead becomes our victim, leaving us with blood on our hands wondering how we got here. We need a stronger, positive love to pull us out and point us in the right direction. Something that will possess us, driving us away from pointless violence towards peace with neighbor and union with Christ. 

https://www.monergism.com/thethreshold/sdg/Chalmers,%20Thomas%20-%20The%20Exlpulsive%20Power%20of%20a%20New%20Af.pdf
